note: Poverty data is expressed in [international-$](#dod:int_dollar_abbreviation) at 2017 prices. Depending on the country and year, it relates to income measured after taxes and benefits, or to consumption, [per capita](#dod:per-capita).
title: Share in extreme poverty vs. life expectancy at birth
subtitle: Life expectancy at birth is defined as the average number of years a newborn would live if age-specific mortality rates in the current year were to stay the same throughout its life. Extreme poverty is defined as living below the International Poverty Line of $2.15 per day, adjusted for inflation and for differences in the cost of living between countries.
